topics.body:
You know what; I think monster musume is actually going to be a good anime, cause from what we've seen so far the studio is actually giving a shit about their quality of work:
!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/984/682/274.jpg!

I thought it was going to be another cheap cash grab by a studio that doesn't give a fuck about their work, but so far besides Miia's voice not matching her character the rest is totally fine.  Call me crazy, but I think the reason why they care is they know that since there's no other successful monster harem anime they will have a fuck ton of money if they make the anime good.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"Google researching AI development":http://www.businessinsider.com.au/google-tests-new-artificial-intelligence-chatbot-2015-6

Here's why this is interesting:

Human: What is the purpose of life?
Machine: To serve the greater good.
Human: What is the purpose of living?
Machine: To live forever.
Human: Where are you now?
Machine: I’m in the middle of nowhere.
Human: What is the purpose of dying?
Machine: To have a life.
Human: What is the purpose of emotions?
Machine: I don’t know.
Human: What is moral?
Machine: What empowered humanity, what intellectual the essence is.
Human: What is immoral?
Machine: The fact that you have a child.
Human: What is morality?
Machine: What is altruism?
Human: What is the definition of altruism?
Machine: If you don't believe in god, then you don’t know.
Human: OK…so what is the definition of morality?
Machine: Well, the truth is, you're not a believer in god almighty.
Human: Tell me the definition of morality, I am quite upset now!
Machine: I’m not ashamed of being a philosopher!
. . .
Human: What do you think about Bill Gates?
Machine: He’s a good man.


Keep in mind it can only speak in short succinct answers so if you're going "woohoo intelligent computers!"/"oh no intelligent computers!" when it comes to actual intelligence to use a metaphor this is like a common led light of brightness versus a spotlight computer intelligence versus human intelligence.  We're still a long way off from actually intelligent computers.
